medical_history.chief_complaint: 24 hours of right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Started 24 hours ago as sharp and stabbing for a few hours, then resolved. Followed by mild dull pain in the RUQ. One episode of nausea and vomiting. No fevers or chills. Normal bowel movements, no dysuria.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), hyperlipidemia, glaucoma, Total Abdominal Hysterectomy (TAH), cataracts, repair of bladder prolapse.
